00004 /*! \file octeon_debug.h
00005     \brief  Host Driver: Debug routines to print Octeon driver structures and data.
00006 */
00007 
00008 
00009 #ifndef __OCTEON_DEBUG_H__
00010 #define __OCTEON_DEBUG_H__
00011 
00012 #ifdef CAVIUM_DEBUG
00013 #include "octeon-common.h"
00014 
00015 /** Print buffer contents.
00016  *  @param data   - buffer to print
00017  *  @param size   - number of bytes to print from buffer.
00018  */
00019 void print_data(uint8_t *data, uint32_t size);
00020 
00021 
00022 
00023 /**  Print the input queue contents. 
00024  *   @param  oct_dev  - pointer to the octeon device.
00025  *   @param  iq_no    - instruction queue whose contents are printed.
00026  *
00027  *   Prints the commands in the instruction queue.
00028  */
00029 void print_queue(octeon_device_t  *oct_dev,
00030                  int               iq_no );
00031 
00032 /**  Print the pending list contents.
00033  *   @param  oct_dev  - pointer to the octeon device.
00034  *
00035  *   Prints certain fields of the soft instruction in each entry.
00036  */ 
00037 void  print_pending_list(octeon_device_t *oct_dev);
00038 
00039 
00040 /**  Print the response list contents.
00041  *   @param octeon_dev   - pointer to the octeon device.
00042  *   @param list_number  - response list to be printed.
00043  *
00044  *   Prints some fields of the pending list entries attached to the
00045  *   response list.
00046  */
00047 void print_response_list(octeon_device_t  *octeon_dev,
00048                          uint32_t            list_number);
00049 
00050 
00051 /**  Print contents of Octeon registers.
00052  *   @param octeon_dev  - pointer to the octeon device.
00053  *   
00054  *   Prints the contents of the config space registers, the
00055  *   CSR and the windowed registers.
00056  */
00057 void print_octeon_regs(octeon_device_t  *octeon_dev);
00058 
00059 
00060 /** Print contents of request info structure. 
00061  *  @param req_info - pointer to request info structure.
00062  */
00063 void print_req_info(octeon_request_info_t  *req_info);
00064 
00065 
00066 
00067 
00068 /**   Prints contents of a soft instruction.
00069  *    @param octeon_dev  - pointer to the octeon device.
00070  *    @param soft_instr  - pointer the soft instruction structure.
00071  *
00072  *    Prints all the fields of a soft instruction; decoding the type
00073  *    of request that created the instruction and also scatter/gather
00074  *    list contents.
00075  */
00076 void print_soft_instr(octeon_device_t             *octeon_dev,
00077                       octeon_soft_instruction_t   *soft_instr);
00078 
00079 
00080 /** Print the command posted to a instruction queue.
00081  *  @param iq_mode  -  the mode of the instruction (32-byte/64-byte)
00082  *  @param  arg      -  the command to be printed.
00083  *
00084  *  The command is printed in the format hinted by the iq_mode.
00085  */
00086 void octeon_print_command(OCTEON_IQ_INSTRUCTION_MODE    iq_mode,
00087                           void                         *arg);
00088 
00089 
00090 /**  Print the contents of a scatter/gather list.
00091  *   @param  sg     - pointer to the scatter/gather list.
00092  *   @param  count  - the number of entries in the list.
00093  *
00094  *   Prints the contents of the list for the number of entries
00095  *   hinted by the count.
00096  */
00097 void print_sg_list(octeon_sg_entry_t  *sg, uint32_t count );
00098 
00099 
00100 /* Print first 8 bytes of each instruction posted to Octeon. */
00101 /* The list may wrap around if more instructions than the size of stamp list
00102    is posted. */
00103 void octeon_print_stamps(void);
00104 
00105 /* Add the first 8 bytes of data at dptr to the next index in the stamp list
00106    The list may wrap around if more instructions than the size of stamp list
00107    is posted. */
00108 void octeon_add_stamp(uint64_t *dptr, uint32_t q_index);

00132 #define oct_push_profile()      do{ }while(0);
00133 #define oct_pop_profile()       do{ }while(0);
00134 #define oct_print_profile(msg)  do{ }while(0);

00141 
00142 static inline void
00143 cavium_error_print_data(uint8_t *data, int size)
00144 {
00145   int i;
00146 
00147   if(data == NULL) {
00148      cavium_print_msg("%s: NULL Pointer found\n", __CVM_FUNCTION__);
00149      return;
00150   }
00151 
00152   cavium_print_msg("Printing %d bytes @ 0x%p\n", size,  data);
00153   for(i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00154     if(!(i & 0x7))
00155       cavium_print_msg("\n");
00156     cavium_print_msg(" %02x", data[i]);
00157   }
00158   cavium_print_msg("\n");
00159 }
